channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: A federal judge in Washington has denied former Trump strategist Steve Bannon’s motion to throw out his indictment on contempt-of-Congress charges https://t.co/BrLdoaqKLy
The Federal Reserve raises rates by 0.75 points and signals a more aggressive path for interest-rate hikes #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/ZaJ0RxsK2v https://t.co/DvLwfWBpCb
R.I.P., Internet Explorer. Microsoft has pulled the plug on its venerable browser after more than 27 years. https://t.co/zpyv7vQk1A
A federal court has ruled that it is unconstitutional for a North Carolina charter school to require girls to wear skirts https://t.co/8FuzSno75c

Chinese leader Xi Jinping again fell short of publicly siding with Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine during a telephone call Wednesday with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, according to an account from state broadcaster Chinese Central Television https://t.co/OUbvi9dHjV
Covid vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna were recommended for kids as young as 6 months by FDA advisers. It's the last major group waiting for the shots. https://t.co/NZrDnS9lgD

WWE’s board is investigating a secret $3 million settlement that longtime CEO Vince McMahon reached with a former employee with whom he allegedly had an affair, according to documents and people familiar https://t.co/FXdiFlpfiq
President Biden will sign an executive order aimed at improving protections for LGBT people that includes efforts to counter laws around transgender youths https://t.co/bGFmuWVW9w
Dr. Anthony Fauci has tested positive for Covid-19 https://t.co/AVqsSreve5
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/Ch4s4Ar5xM
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/aEo6WuZwdG https://t.co/Kova3KiQWT
For the first time, scientists have discovered where the Black Death originated from: a mountainous region of modern-day Kyrgyzstan https://t.co/TScW1p9zzF
Lego said it is going to spend $1 billion to build a factory in Virginia. The new facility is expected to create more than 1,700 jobs. https://t.co/b7TR2885tr

BP is taking the lead on a more-than-$30 billion project to produce massive amounts of hydrogen from renewable energy in Australia’s Outback, a major bet on a promising alternative fuel that is in growing demand but remains expensive https://t.co/Ir83ONFnnb
Bartenders beware! Coca-Cola is rolling out premixed cans of Jack and Coke. It will have about 5% alcohol and make it easy to have the classic cocktail without a bar. https://t.co/tgclCFKHlM
Returning office workers get creative to help their lonely dogs cope: "Judge Judy" and robotic vacuums https://t.co/qzhb2jbOT4
Minnesota Timberwolves owner and former Walmart executive Marc Lore’s new food-truck startup has a $3.5 billion valuation, and he wants to expand to new regions https://t.co/TFlCN0xnQa
R.I.P., Internet Explorer https://t.co/FVHjZOjdP9

Rep. Tom Rice, one of the 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach Donald Trump, has lost in a South Carolina primary, the AP projects. Trump-backed state Rep. Russell Fry won. https://t.co/fg5KnhDXmC
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/iKbVb1GK4A https://t.co/0CpccmUK6x
Where did officials go wrong on inflation? They applied an old playbook to a new crisis. “We fought the last war.” https://t.co/RoDK8kbXDV
All entrances to Yellowstone National Park are closed indefinitely, the National Park Service said, warning of dangerous conditions and the risk of rockslides https://t.co/wZyPOeld8q
Caterpillar is moving its headquarters to Texas from its longtime base in Illinois, the latest major manufacturer to leave the state in recent weeks https://t.co/dQrVBBm6Ta
The metaverse economy is expected to grow to $5 trillion by 2030 and encompass daily activities such as socializing and remote learning, consulting firm McKinsey said https://t.co/bACSPWDOK0
Crypto lender Celsius Network has hired restructuring lawyers to advise on possible solutions for its mounting financial problems https://t.co/LOGUEOH67U
R.I.P., Internet Explorer https://t.co/X21KxA3ikw
Caterpillar is moving its headquarters to Texas from its longtime base in Illinois, the latest major manufacturer to leave the state in recent weeks https://t.co/Xk9qpM71TY

From @WSJopinion: Inflation wasn’t real. Then it was "transitory." Now we’re told the Fed will cure it with a few rate hikes. Only a true wishful thinker could be confident of that, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/ptoVhmatjt
K-pop boy band BTS said they are going on hiatus to take time away from the group to grow and mature as individuals, as well as work on solo music https://t.co/yn9lWabaGh
Heavy rains ravaged Yellowstone National Park and forced visitors to evacuate just as the summer tourism season was underway #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/MavGwS7s80 https://t.co/HqNzeizPQB
Where did officials go wrong on inflation? They applied an old playbook to a new crisis. “We fought the last war.” https://t.co/pUsad5niZX
The S&P 500 closed in a bear market, sliding 3.9%, as stocks plunged on fears about the pace of Fed rate increases. The Dow dropped about 875 points. https://t.co/Mv06XtVXBR

Google suspended an engineer who contended that an artificial-intelligence chatbot the company developed had become sentient, telling him that he had violated the company’s confidentiality policy after it dismissed his claims. https://t.co/3f8gTmTQsu
Where did officials go wrong on inflation? They applied an old playbook to a new crisis. “We fought the last war.” https://t.co/69RF6M9wnZ
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/MjyVh3RPyv https://t.co/0kxMSpN2pl
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/SvQleCLMB6 https://t.co/yHQ4FX7Tk1

“I told him that it was crazy stuff.” During a House Committee investigation of the Jan. 6 storming of the U.S. Capitol, former Attorney General William Barr said Donald Trump showed little interest in the actual facts about the election results. https://t.co/Wvj7Whd2SL

Elon Musk will participate in an all-hands meeting with Twitter employees Thursday, marking the first time the billionaire has spoken directly with the company’s workforce since he began his courtship of it in April https://t.co/x2HcbcTAln

Hot-sauce lovers are going to be in for a rude awakening: A sriracha shortage is coming. “We can confirm that there is an unprecedented shortage of our products,” says Huy Fong Foods, citing weather-related issues that hurt its chili crops. https://t.co/unEyUHECE1
Idaho police said they are receiving death threats following the weekend arrests of 31 people believed to be members of white supremacist group Patriot Front https://t.co/bZQNz7ObHb

Nearly 37 years after its release, Kate Bush's “Running Up That Hill (A Deal With God)" reached No. 4 on the Billboard singles chart Monday thanks to Netflix’s “Stranger Things" and a legion of new fans https://t.co/oe7xuTP5x6

With the U.S. sending roughly $130 million a day in military aid to Ukraine plus economic and other assistance, current and former U.S. officials warn that more must be done to ensure arms and money aren’t diverted, stolen or misused https://t.co/Dw45ioUDYG
Bartenders beware! Coca-Cola is rolling out premixed cans of Jack and Coke. It will have about 5% alcohol and make it easy to have the classic cocktail without a bar. https://t.co/I3RWhpvMnC
Bartenders beware! Coca-Cola is rolling out premixed cans of Jack and Coke. It will have about 5% alcohol and make it easy to have the classic cocktail without a bar. https://t.co/Lwm8L5rfgL

From @WSJopinion: We wish we didn’t have to write this, but we live in fanatical times when political violence is all too possible. Protecting democracy means protecting all of its institutions. https://t.co/kPdPhbnVW5
High inflation is likely to lead the Fed to consider surprising markets with a larger-than-expected 0.75-percentage-point rate increase this week https://t.co/VOUZs3Liae
The Dow dropped about 550 points and Treasury yields surged on inflation worries. The S&P 500 slid 2.2%, putting it in bear-market territory. https://t.co/3QD4j5Q6ie
Ukraine’s fate will largely depend on how fast and in what quantities new heavy weapons arrive from the U.S. and its allies https://t.co/OYifvT1Dhl

“Squid Game” is coming back. Netflix confirmed the popular dystopian drama will return for a second season and said work on the episodes was still in its early stages, but didn't include a planned release date. https://t.co/h7PcKr0xVJ
No one is sure why Japan’s Covid-19 death rate is lower than other wealthy nations, but mask-wearing and low obesity might play a role https://t.co/5FpIaVr9pd
